newsitem.title: UK: UK grain futures down in quiet trading.
newsitem.headline: UK grain futures down in quiet trading.

text.p: LIFFE wheat and barley futures drifted down amid minimal volume in lacklustre pre-holiday trading, traders said.
They put falls of up to 0.75 stg for wheat, with active May last traded 0.60 stg lower at 100.40, down to weaker values in export markets.
Barley also fell, with active January last traded 1.00 stg lower at 93.25 stg per tonne.
Just 99 lots of wheat traded during the day, consisting of 13 lots of January and 86 lots of May.
Barley traded just 13 lots, 8 lots of January and 5 of November. --Christopher Lyddon, London Newsroom +44 171 542 7928
